page.title: 08HISTORY OF MATHON CHURCH.
page.content: The original Norman church was shorter and lower than the present one,only the east end still has the original Norman deep sill and heavy stone window. The only seats were at the side,the congregation stood or knelt,only the elderly or sick used the seats round the wall.Hence the saying{Let the weak {go to the wall.} There are many interesting memorial plaques on the floor and walls but the Norman{font}has been lost.There is a very fine{pulpit}of carved oak and an excellent organ. The{Piscina}_ a drain for left over altar wine from the Communion _ has a plug believed to be the original elm bung.It is now to all intents and purposes petrified by wine and time.
